abstract: The synth-pop duo known as Bubbles recently performed at the Agnès B. flagship store in Soho.
snippet: The synth-pop duo known as Bubbles recently performed at the Agnès B. flagship store in Soho.
lead_paragraph: The synth-pop duo known as Bubbles recently performed at the Agnès B. flagship store in Soho. A crowd of forty or so looked on as Alain Levitt banged on his machines, and Jason P. Grisell flailed around the small stage area. Endearingly low-maintenance, the group wins hearts with their unpretentious slacks, sneakers, and baseball hats. Bubbles has played most of the better underground venues in New York, and is steadily gaining steam. And yet, while Levitt's music was danceable and solidly interesting, Grisell's vocals left the audience pondering whether or not we are in for a revival of that No-Wave school of "Can't sing? Start a hit band!'"
